item.title: Time-series decomposition and trend analysis in Python
item.description: There are a number of methods to accomplish time-series decompositions in R, including the decompose and STL commands. I haven’t come across a seasonal decomposition method in Python comparable to R’s STL. However, statsmodels 0.6 added a naive seasonal decomposition method similar to R’s decompose that is not as powerful as the LOESS method used in STL. Let’s run through an example: import urllib2 import datetime as datetime import pandas as pd import statsmodels.
